phrases.text: Hò hò đưa linh hưm hư hứ A đưa linh ơ phản ơ hồi

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "hò" - work song - sung while laboring (rowing, farming, etc.). Work songs from Central and Southern Vietnam, sung during communal labor.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice
Often featured call-and-response between workers to maintain rhythm
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This onomatopoeia phrase contains 14 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. Onomatopoetic phrases use repeated notes or simple patterns to imitate sounds. Strong rhythmic foundation matching physical work movements.

phrases.text: Ai đem chiếc ư thuyền loan qua bể Bắc ư ơ ơ ư không ơ cho a chim nhạn đậu ư chốn ơ non ơ đoài

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "Ông" - respectful address for married men. This narrative phrase advances the story, grounding the emotional content in concrete imagery. Work songs from Central and Southern Vietnam, sung during communal labor.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice
Often featured call-and-response between workers to maintain rhythm
Vietnamese uses formal address terms even in intimate folk songs, reflecting Confucian respect culture
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
culturalContext.musicalContext: This narrative phrase contains 26 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. Narrative phrases typically use moderate melodic range and steady rhythm to advance the story. Strong rhythmic foundation matching physical work movements.
